text: Nimbus One is a 1U rack-mounted network security appliance providing L3/L7 traffic inspection, policy routing, firewall, and VPN termination for up to 10,000 clients.
Nimbus One ships in Standard and Pro editions. Pro adds redundant power supplies (dual PSU), 40GbE uplinks, and hardware TLS acceleration.
Appliance dimensions 1U, depth 430mm. Dual Intel Xeon Silver, 64GB RAM (up to 256GB), 2x 1TB NVMe (RAID1 optional), hot-swap fans.
Front: 2x USB-A, LCD service panel. Rear: 8x 10GbE SFP+, 2x 1GbE RJ45, 1x management RJ45, serial console RJ45 (RJ45 console cable).
100–240V AC, 50/60Hz, 1.2A. Pro supports dual redundant PSUs with automatic failover (hot-swap).
Operating temp 10–35°C (50–95°F). Non-condensing humidity 10–85%. Acoustic noise <45dB at 1m.
Base license includes routing, firewall, logging. Add-ons: Advanced Threat Protection (ATP), GeoIP filter, Global VPN.
Firmware is delivered quarterly. Web UI: Maintenance → Updates → Check → Install. CLI: 'nimbus fw-update --check && nimbus fw-update --install'.
Soft reset: hold Reset for 5s. Factory reset: hold Reset 15s until LCD flashes (pinhole). Clears configuration and admin password to defaults.
Default management IP 192.168.1.10/24, username admin, password admin123. Change password at first login. Web UI: https://192.168.1.10.
Supported: routed (default), transparent bridge, policy-based routing (PBR). Switching is not supported.
Static routes and BGPv4 supported. BGP requires Pro license. Max route table size 1,000,000 entries. Use 'show bgp summary' to verify sessions.
Stateless ACLs and stateful inspection. Up to 2000 rules. Objects: networks, ports, users, tags. Example: allow TCP 443 outbound for group 'IT'.
Source NAT (SNAT) and Destination NAT (DNAT). Port forwarding templates for HTTP/HTTPS/SSH. Example: DNAT 203.0.113.10:443 → 10.0.0.10:443.
IPsec IKEv2 and WireGuard supported. Max tunnels: 200 (Standard) / 1000 (Pro). Example: 'nimbus vpn create --type wireguard'.
Pro only. Decrypts outbound TLS using installed root CA. Bypass lists for domains/categories. Warning: Breaks some pinned apps.
Priority queues and bandwidth caps per VLAN/user group. DSCP marking optional. Use 'show qos stats'.
Syslog over UDP/TCP, local ring buffer (2GB). SIEM export via JSON over HTTPS. Example endpoint: /api/v1/logs/export
SSH to the management IP. Run 'nimbus help'. Enter 'configure' for config mode. Commit using 'commit; save'. Example: 'set firewall rule 10 action allow'.
REST API at https://<host>/api/v1. Auth via API keys in 'X-API-Key'. Rate limit 600 req/min. Example: GET /api/v1/system/health
Download config from Maintenance → Backups. CLI: 'nimbus backup create --to usb'. Verify backup integrity with 'nimbus backup verify'.
Restore via Maintenance → Backups → Restore. CLI: '--from usb' or '--from url'. Reboot required. Verify via 'show system restore-status'.
Collect logs via Maintenance → Support Bundle. CLI: 'nimbus diag bundle --now'. Check hardware: 'show system sensors'.
E101 PSU failure (check power feed), E102 fan failure, E201 disk degraded (replace NVMe), E301 license expired, E401 BGP session down (verify neighbor).
Max concurrent sessions 3,000,000; policies 10,000; VLANs 1024; QoS queues 256.
FIPS 140-3 pending, CE, FCC Class A. Data-at-rest encryption AES-256-GCM.
NIM-1U-STD, NIM-1U-PRO, NIM-PSU-AC, NIM-FAN-HOTSWAP, NIM-SFP-10G-SR.
